description:
Agaricus bisporus var. bisporus H97 is a variety of the common button mushroom, scientifically known as Agaricus bisporus. It is a cultivated strain of the species, which is widely grown for commercial and culinary purposes.

Agaricus bisporus is a member of the Agaricaceae family, a group of fungi that includes many edible and commercially important mushroom species. The var. bisporus H97 strain is characterized by its ability to produce spores with a bisporic (two-spored) basidia, which is an uncommon trait within the species.

This variety is typically white or light-colored, with a convex to flattened cap that can reach up to 10 cm in diameter. The stipe (stem) is short and thick, and the gills are initially white, turning pink and then brown as the mushroom matures.

Agaricus bisporus var. bisporus H97 is widely cultivated and consumed around the world for its edible, nutritious, and flavorful properties. It is commonly used in a variety of culinary dishes, from soups and stews to saut√©s and omelets.
